thread.title: Steve Spurrier still not over 2001 loss to Tennessee
thread.title_full: Steve Spurrier still not over 2001 loss to Tennessee

title: Steve Spurrier still not over 2001 loss to Tennessee
text:
Steve Spurrier still not over 2001 loss to Tennessee Steve Spurrier may never get over this loss.   
One loss still haunts Steve Spurrier nearly 16 years after the fact. 
The Old Ball Coach recently detailed a 2001 loss to Tennessee, which also happened to be the last home game he coached at Florida, in a report from the Orlando Sentinel . Spurrier left Florida for the NFL at the conclusion of the 2001 season. 
“We finished third in the nation that year and didn’t win anything,” Spurrier said. “That Tennessee loss was so crucial, because I really thought we had a team that could go all the way. Losing that game hurt a lot. I don’t know if you ever completely get over a loss like that.” 
It was the regular-season finale for both teams, as the game was postponed to Dec. 1 after the Sept. 11 attacks on the United States forced the matchup to be moved from its customary third week in September date. Florida and Tennessee both entered as top-five teams with 9-1 records, but the Gators were 17-point favorites. A trip to the SEC title game was on the line, and another win there would have meant a trip to the national championship game in the Rose Bowl. 
The Vols pulled off a 34-32 upset behind a Herculean effort from running back Travis Stephens, who rushed for 226 yards and two touchdowns. It was the first time that season an opponent scored more than 23 points against Florida. Auburn beat the Gators 23-20, but no other team even eclipsed 17 points on Florida's defense until Tennessee's victory. 
“We had such a super, super team that year,” Spurrier said. “That’s why the loss was so hard to take. Tennessee ran it right down our throats.” 
Neither team ended up playing for the national championship that season — Miami defeated Nebraska — as Tennessee was on the wrong end of an upset to LSU in the 2001 SEC Championship Game. But Tennessee's upset of Florida will likely always hang in the back of Spurrier's mind. Author
